question: Does K_avg=2.0 crossing produce observable structural discontinuity (phase transition)?
method: Run nk_null_model.py at K=2.0 crossing; measure hub z, Gini z, isolation z against null; check 4 falsification predictions from DOMEX-NK-S356 design.
expect: K_avg crosses 2.0 at N≈555; null predictions all confirmed (no discontinuity)

falsification_predictions.P1_cycle_emergence: FALSIFIED (33 cycles since K=0.77, not new at K=2.0)
falsification_predictions.P2_isolation_significant: PARTIALLY (z=2.810 now sig, but gradual trend, not discontinuity)

actual.null_hypothesis: K=2.0 is arithmetic milestone (mean 2 citations/lesson), not phase transition
actual.null_verdict: CONFIRMED — crossing is smooth, no structural discontinuity

diff: Expected discontinuity at K=2.0 if NK chaos theory applied. Actual: smooth crossing, all structural metrics change continuously. Isolation z crossed significance (was marginal at N=545), but this is a continuous trend not a threshold jump. F9-NK chaos framing REJECTED.
conclusions: K=2.0 crossing is smooth and continuous — no phase transition signature
NK Boolean network chaos theory does not apply to text citation graphs
K_avg=2.0 marks structural maturity (scale-free citation regime), not chaos onset
F9-NK chaos boundary question RESOLVED: abandon chaos framing, retain structural metrics
Isolation z gradual increase (1.79→2.81 over N=529→554) is session-type driven, not crossing-driven
